titleStmt.title: Good news from Ireland being an exact relation of the late good successe at Sliggo against the Irish rebels. Communicated to both Houses of Parliament on Munday last 12. Ianuary 1645. Performed by Charles Coot, Sir William Cole, and Sir Francis Hamilton, with the particulars thereof. As also divers letters of great importance concerning the estate of that kingdome and of the kingdome of England, which were found in the pockets of their commander in chiefe. Together with a list of the prisoners taken, the number slaine on both sides, and the names of all the commanders. Published by authority.

Good news from Ireland being an exact relation of the late good successe at Sliggo against the Irish rebels. Communicated to both Houses of Parliament on Munday last 12. Ianuary 1645. Performed by Charles Coot, Sir William Cole, and Sir Francis Hamilton, with the particulars thereof. As also divers letters of great importance concerning the estate of that kingdome and of the kingdome of England, which were found in the pockets of their commander in chiefe. Together with a list of the prisoners taken, the number slaine on both sides, and the names of all the commanders. Published by authority.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Iohn Wright at the Kings Head in the old Bayley.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
